feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days count. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.

Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components, choosing calculation methods, and defining eligible leave types.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on payroll
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role and access to payroll settings; payroll system must be configured

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days or calendar days in the month based on leave policy, and public holidays falling within the month
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method selection (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and leave types are included in encashment calculations.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation that applies daily rates to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to factor into the calculations.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select applicable salary components for leave encashment (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types eligible for end-of-service encashment calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of actual working days in the month. Leave policy can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to calculate actual working days used in the formula

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month, e.g., 31 for January, 28 for February), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible, commonly set to 30 in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select the calculation base.

Salary components are limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation methods are limited to calendar days, working days, or custom days. Super admins can configure specific leave types for encashment eligibility.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected during policy configuration

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be identified and subtracted from the total working days before calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days

Calculation varies depending on month length when using calendar days (e.g., 31 days in January versus 28 days in February), and different calculation methods can significantly impact final wage calculations for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Super admins can view which existing eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when applying new Daily Wage Calculator configurations.

Multiple calculation method options (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and day type options (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days) are available; selection impacts how daily deductions are computed
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Integrates with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; interacts with leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems to access salary information
The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, end-of-service eligibility configuration, and leave management systems to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service calculations.
Integrates with the payroll system to apply daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; works in conjunction with Leave Policies configuration
Interacts with Payroll system, payroll table (active/unpaid amounts), and affects employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount used for deducting unpaid leave, derived by dividing total salary by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, resulting in salary deduction based on daily pay calculation

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA.

Leave encashment: The process of converting accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation during end-of-service. Daily Wage Calculator: A payroll configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits and compensation upon departure.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage; Basic Only: Calculation using base salary only; Basic + Allowances: Calculation including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: All days including weekends; Working days: Business days only; Custom days: User-defined day calculation

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): Feature within payroll settings that manages salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
